image.altText: Natasha Fyles stands side on to a lectern with a number of microphones on it.

items.synopsis: The Northern Territory Chief Minister is spruiking the NT as a land of untapped opportunity for major new industries including gas fracking and cotton she says are "too important to be ignored".

title.children: 'Incredible opportunities' for new gas, lithium and cotton industries in the NT, says chief minister

image.altText: Steph Catley

items.synopsis: The Matildas put the rest of the tournament on notice with a clinical 4-0 victory over Canada in the Women's World Cup in Melbourne.

title.children: Matildas score stunning 4-0 victory over Canada to progress into the World Cup knock-out stages

items.synopsis: The Great Barrier Reef is likely to avoid being listed as in danger for at least another year as a United Nations body recommends delaying a decision on its World Heritage status.

title.children: Australia was granted a reprieve on the Great Barrier Reef being labelled 'in danger'. Here's why

image.altText: England captain Ben Stokes hugs bowler Stuart Broad after the fifth Ashes Test at The Oval.

items.synopsis: Australia falls 49 runs short of England in its chase on the last day of the final Test of the Ashes, with a 2-2 draw good enough for Australia to retain the Urn.

title.children: Australia's batting collapses on last day of Ashes as series ends in a draw

image.altText: Pat Cummins holds the Ashes urn while standing in a group of his fellow players

items.synopsis: An Ashes series that delivered on every promise ends in a 2-2 draw, but with enough memories, emotions and stories to last a lifetime, writes Dean Bilton.

title.children: An unforgettable Ashes series ends in a draw, but provides enough stories to last a lifetime

image.altText: A man stands talking on the phone looking out the window.

items.synopsis: Telstra is sending letters to its deceased customers despite their family members pleading for the telco to stop the mail.

title.children: A call for help: Families plea for Telstra to stop sending letters about dead loved ones

image.altText: White banner saying "another sold" following house sale

items.synopsis: House prices continue to rise, but there are further signs that a recent rebound may be losing steam as spring selling season approaches and the appeal of life outside the cities fades post-pandemic.

title.children: House price recovery slows as listings rise and regional markets stagnate

image.altText: 'X' logo is seen on the top of the headquarters of the messaging platform X.

items.synopsis: Today's latest news, as it happens.

title.children: Flashing 'X' sign removed from Twitter HQ, Biden picks permanent home for US Space Command — get in The Loop

image.altText: Man sits in red seat with grey suit

items.synopsis: The actor, best known for the cultural phenomenon Pee-wee Herman, has died aged 70.

title.children: Actor and comedian Paul Reubens, known for Pee-wee Herman, dies

image.altText: Philip Lowe giving evidence, resting his head on his hand.

items.synopsis: Inflation might be rapidly falling, but economists will stick to their textbooks to argue another rate rise is needed. It's little wonder why it's earned the reputation of being the dismal science, writes business editor Ian Verrender.

title.children: With inflation rapidly falling, there's a strong case that the RBA has pushed too hard on interest rates

image.altText: Rohan smiles, sitting next to an adult on the couch. He has brown hair.

items.synopsis: Juvenile arthritis is one of the most common chronic diseases affecting Australian children, but a scarcity of specialists is making diagnosis and care a challenge.

title.children: Rohan developed a limp at 18 months — it took months to discover he had juvenile arthritis

image.altText: Peter Dutton in the prime minister's courtyard

items.synopsis: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton says he has requested a meeting with the head of the Australian Federal Police for "further detail" about a briefing the AFP says it gave him in 2018, but which Mr Dutton does not recall.

title.children: Dutton seeks meeting with AFP commissioner for 'further detail' on Nauru contractor briefing

image.altText: A composite of three sportswomen in pale blue uniforms celebrating.

items.synopsis: Hayley Raso becomes a household name in 45 minutes of football, as Sam Kerr gets another much-needed spell on the sidelines. These are the five talking points from last night.

title.children: Five quick hits — Raso the star in first-half domination and Kerr gets an unexpected rest

image.altText: Zane Mellor in a pool reaches for the camera.

items.synopsis: A mother who lost her son in the Hillcrest jumping castle tragedy more than 18 months ago says she feels like she's "stuck in a time warp waiting for answers" as a legal battle continues over whether to delay an inquest.

title.children: Anguish for mum of Hillcrest jumping castle victim as legal tussle over inquest delays 'justice'

image.altText: A woman wearing an orange shirt holds a blowtorch to a a bat

items.synopsis: Indonesia's most infamous meat market has officially banned the sale of dog and cat, but disease experts say the thriving bat trade continues to pose a public health threat.

title.children: In Indonesia, roasted bats are a delicacy. Some experts fear they could also harbour the next pandemic

image.altText: A surfer paddles onto a wave as the supermoon rises off the Sydney beachside suburb of Wanda

items.synopsis: August is kicking off with what's known as a sturgeon supermoon and ending with a Blue Supermoon (although it won't be coloured blue). Here's what you need to know.

title.children: We're getting two supermoons this month. Let's unpack what that means

image.altText: A man sits in a wheelchair and a small screen is positioned in front of his face.

items.synopsis: The University of Wollongong hopes that for decades and centuries to come the professor's name will be associated with the fight to treat neurodegenerative diseases.

title.children: Legacy of scientist Justin Yerbury honoured with creation of academic role

image.altText: A scene of streets leading to the ocean on Palm Island, North Queensland.

items.synopsis: Police say the woman was dragged from her wheelchair by two dogs and bitten multiple times on her neck, face and arms, in the remote Indigenous community of Palm Island off the North Queensland coast.

title.children: Woman loses ear in vicious island dog attack

image.altText: A white tractor.

items.synopsis: Pre-1982 tractors should be banned from commercial use, a Tasmanian coroner says, following the death of a father and son in separate accidents while using the same kind of tractor, 43 years apart.

title.children: Old tractor ban recommended after death of father and son, 43 years apart, while using same machine

image.altText: A destroyed building in Ukraine's Luhansk region.

items.synopsis: So far, the Ukrainians appear to have been able to minimise Russian gains in Luhansk. But what does this new Russian offensive tell us about Russia's strategy and the trajectory of the war, asks Mick Ryan.

title.children: What Russia's 'forgotten offensive' tells us about the trajectory of war in Ukraine

image.altText: A crowd at a funeral carrying a coffin.

items.synopsis: The militant group says it carried out the attack on a rally of supporters for a hard-line cleric and political leader, killing at least 54 and injuring hundreds more.

title.children: Islamic State claims responsibility for Pakistan political rally bombing that killed 54

image.altText: People walk past a film poster featuring a man in a metallic red and gold suit with Chinese characters

items.synopsis: Hollywood films can make millions at the Chinese box office. What influence is the massive market having on films made in both locations?

title.children: Hollywood has become more dependent on China. That brings risks and rewards

image.altText: For sale sign outside an apartment building along a street in Brisbane

items.synopsis: Brisbane house values rose 4.2 per cent over the three months to the end of July, making it tied with Adelaide for the greatest growth that month.

title.children: Vendors back in control: Brisbane one of the best cities when it comes to growth in housing prices

image.altText: a young woman sick with a cold sitting on a bed blowing her nose with a tissue

items.synopsis: This year's flu season is dragging out longer than previous years and experts say it comes down to people getting vaccinated too late.

title.children: Why is NSW's flu season taking so long to end?

image.altText: A greyhound lies on its bed looking at the camera.

items.synopsis: Figures released by a greyhound welfare organisation reveal dozens of dogs are dying off-track after being injured during their races.

title.children: 'Cheaper dead than alive': Greyhound advocates demand inquiry into racing industry

image.altText: Steph Catley (1st R) of Australia celebrates with teammates after scoring her team's fourth goal

items.synopsis: No Kerr? No problem. The internet went wild as the Matildas shrugged off the pressure of the nation to crush Olympic champions Canada in Melbourne.

title.children: How the internet reacted to the Matildas' 4-0 win over Canada

image.altText: Scott Morrison in house of reps.

items.synopsis: The former prime minister addresses federal parliament for the first time since the royal commission handed down its damning findings earlier this month, doubling down on his rejection of any wrongdoing.

title.children: Scott Morrison accuses the government of 'rank hypocrisy' over Robodebt criticism

image.altText: Richard Marles and Angus Campbel at a press conference.

items.synopsis: Shadow Defence Minister Andrew Hastie says the make of helicopter that crashed in Queensland's Whitsundays during a military exercise had well-documented concerns about its airworthiness.

title.children: Government won't expedite replacements for Taipans involved in Queensland chopper crash

image.altText: A drone is seen in the sky.

items.synopsis: China's commerce ministry called the decision to limit drone exports a matter of "national security".

title.children: China curbs export of drone components to US market

image.altText: A composite image of two men compiled from Facebook profile pictures.

items.synopsis: A man who gunned down two of his neighbours in a "senseless and brutally violent" dispute over a garden hose is likely to die in jail, after he is sentenced to 30 years' prison.

title.children: Melbourne pensioner who killed neighbours over garden hose dispute jailed for 30 years

image.altText: Cara Koenen

items.synopsis: Despite being held to their lowest total yet, the Diamonds roll on with unbeaten form at the Netball World Cup to defeat Scotland 77-37, as the Silver Ferns lose Grace Nweke.

title.children: Australia remain undefeated at Netball World Cup, as New Zealand suffer huge injury blow
